thread.title: Trump: 'we'll see' if North Korea summit still on, will insist on denuclearisation

title: Trump: 'we'll see' if North Korea summit still on, will insist on denuclearisation
text:
May 16, 2018 / 4:40 PM / Updated 19 minutes ago Trump: 'we'll see' if North Korea summit still on, will insist on denuclearisation Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday said it was unclear if his planned summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un would still go forward and said he would continue to insist on denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula. U.S. President Donald Trump looks up during his meeting with Uzbekistan President Shavkat Mirziyoyev at the White House in Washington. U.S., May 16, 2018. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque
“We’ll have to see,” Trump told reporters in the Oval Office when asked if the summit was still on.
“No decision, we haven’t been notified at all ... We haven’t seen anything, we haven’t heard anything,” he said. Reporting by Jeff Mason; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama
